comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: In the 1960s Andronicus Coffee used to have an office here! Now the site of the Regent Hotel

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Well done identifying this - it stumped me, and I used to work at The Regent sometimes. I just came across the reverse view which can also be properly identified - George Street looking north from Essex Street intersection.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thank you! I'll pass along this info for Photo Investigator to be updated.

AB

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hpeters] Love it! Notice the J-class tram on the way to the eastern suburbs via Kings Cross as it crosses George Street at King. Not a motor vehicle in sight!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/hpeters] Terrific find - I was just zapped back 106 years!

comment.author: 100991930@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Hi John I am trying to find an image of 319 george street from the turn of the 20th century. I cant seem to tell if I am looking at the correct image or not. Would you help me find it in these archives? Would help me alot for my architecture project at UNSW
Thank you! t
Tamara

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/100991930@N03] Tamara, here is a picture of the block - 319 George Street located behind the tram in the distance. 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2515555902/]

The shots feature C-class tramcars so my guess would be that the photo was taken about the turn of the 20th century.

Both NSW Archives and the Powerhouse have extensive collections and I'm sure a phone call to one of their friendly archivists could help you find a better shot. In the meantime if I locate another shot I'll let you know. Cheers John

comment.author: 100991930@N03
comment._content:
Thanks so much John that's a huge help. I'll also give the powerhouse a call and hope for a close up.
Tamara
